{{Infobox Congressman | name=Jonathan Brewster Bingham | image name=Jonathan Brewster Bingham.jpg | state=[[New York (state)|New York]] | district=[[United States House of Representatives, New York District 22|22nd]] | party=[[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]] | term_start=January 3, 1973 | term_end=January 3, 1983 | preceded=[[Herman Badillo]] | succeeded=[[Benjamin A. Gilman]] | state2=[[New York (state)|New York]] | district2=[[United States House of Representatives, New York District 23|23rd]] | term_start2=January 3, 1965 | term_end2=January 3, 1973 | preceded2=[[Charles A. Buckley]] | succeeded2=[[Peter A. Peyser]] | birth_date={{Birth date|1914|04|24}} | birth_place=[[New Haven, Connecticut]] | death_date={{Death date and age|1986|07|03|1914|04|24}} | death_place=[[New York City]] | spouse=[[June Bingham Birge|June Rossbach Bingham]] | children= | religion= | occupation= | residence= | alma_mater=[[Yale University]]
[[Yale Law School]] | signature= |nickname = |allegiance = |branch = [[United States Army]] |service_years = April 1943 - October 1945 |awards = [[United States War Department|War Department]] citation |}} '''Jonathan Brewster Bingham''' (April 24, 1914 – July 3, 1986) was an [[United States|American]] politician and diplomat. He was the US delegate to the United Nations General Assemblies and was elected to Congress. ==Early life== Bingham was born in New Haven, Connecticut. His father, [[Hiram Bingham III]], was a [[United States Senator|Senator]] and explorer and his great grandfather, [[Hiram Bingham I]], was a missionary, who helped translate the [[Bible]] into [[Hawaiian language|Hawaiian]]. Bingham attended [[Hamden Hall Country Day School]] and [[Groton School]] and graduated from [[Yale University]] in 1936 with a [[Bachelor of Arts|BA]] and from [[Yale Law School]] in 1939 with a law degree. He was a member of [[Skull and Bones]], class of 1936.[[Alexandra Robbins]], ''Secrets of the Tomb: Skull and Bones, the Ivy League, and the Hidden Paths of Power'', Little, Brown and Company, 2002, p. 165 In 1940 he was admitted to the bar, and began the practice of law in [[New York City]]. His practice was interrupted in August 1941, when he joined the Machinery Branch of the newly created Office of Price Administration (OPA) as a legal advisor. He was not at the OPA for long, for in 1942 he joined the Military Intelligence Service. In April of the following year he was enlisted as a private in the [[United States Army]] and was discharged a captain in October 1945 with a [[United States War Department|War Department]] citation.{{cite web|title=Jonathan Brewster Bingham|url=http://bioguide.congress.gov/scripts/biodisplay.pl?index=B000472|publisher=Biographical Directory of the United States Congress|accessdate=31 August 2013}} ==Diplomat== On his return he was appointed chief of the newly created Alien Enemy Control Section of the [[United States Department of State|State Department]]. The Alien Enemy Control Section was unpopular and short-lived. Bingham got off the boat before it sank, resuming the practice of law in [[New York City]] in 1946. He left the practice of law again in 1951 to become assistant director of the Office of International Security Affairs. Bingham left in the same year to become deputy administrator of the Technical Cooperation Administration, implementing the Point 4 Program of technical assistance to developing countries. His book, ''Shirt-Sleeve Diplomacy: Point 4 in Action,'' was published in 1953. He left the administration in that year and resumed the practice of law. In 1955 he became secretary to fellow Bonesman, [[W. Averell Harriman]], while he was [[Governor of New York]]. When Harriman was defeated in the 1958 election by [[Nelson Aldrich Rockefeller]], Bingham joined the law firm Goldwater & Flynn. In 1961 Bingham entered the world of [[diplomacy]], as a United States representative on the [[United Nations Trusteeship Council]] with rank of Minister in 1961 and 1962, serving as President in 1962. During this period he was also principal adviser to the U.S. ambassador to U.N. on colonial and trusteeship questions. From 1963 to 1964 he was a United States representative on the [[United Nations Economic and Social Council]] with rank of Ambassador. He was also alternate representative to the 15th and 18th [[United Nations General Assembly|United Nations General Assemblies]]. ==Congress== In 1964 he was elected to the House of Representatives from the 23rd District of [[New York (state)|New York]], a district in the Bronx, at a time when elections in the Bronx were decided in the Democratic primaries in contests between "regular" or machine Democrats, and "reform" or challenger Democrats. Bingham defeated Charles Buckley, the leader of the Bronx "regular" Democrats and a powerful, senior committee chairman in Congress, in a re-match following Bingham's defeat in his first try against the incumbent Buckley in the 1962 Democratic primary.{{cn|date=May 2018}} Bingham represented the 23rd District from January 3, 1965 until January 3, 1973, when, as a result of redistricting following the 1970 census, he was elected to the House from the 22nd District of New York following a bruising primary with neighboring Democratic incumbent congressman [[James H. Scheuer]]. He served the 22nd District from January 3, 1973 until January 3, 1983,{{cite web|title=Jonathan Brewster Bingham|url=http://www.govtrack.us/congress/members/jonathan_bingham/401453|publisher=Govtrack US Congress|accessdate=31 August 2013}} but did not pursue re-election when, in 1982, his district essentially disappeared as a result of yet another post-census redistricting. While in the House, Bingham served on the Foreign Affairs Committee, the Interior and Insular Affairs Committee and chaired the Subcommittee on International Economic Policy and Trade. He was particularly dedicated to nuclear non-proliferation and environmental protection. On leaving congress he took up the practice of law as special counsel with Pryor, Cashman, Sherman & Flynn. He also lectured at Columbia University School of Law. During his lifetime Bingham contributed articles to various publications. He also authored Shirt Sleeve Diplomacy-Point 4 in Action (1954) and Violence and Democracy (1970). {{citation needed|date=April 2010}} ==Affiliations== He was a fellow of the Yale Corporation from 1949 to 1951, and served on its executive committee from 1951 to 1953. Bingham served on the board of directors of the People for the American Way, the United Nations Development Corporation, U.S. Committee for UNICEF and the Population Crisis Committee. He was a member of the [[Council on Foreign Relations]] and the [[Century Association]]. {{citation needed|date=April 2010}} ==Family== He was married to [[June Bingham Birge|June Rossbach]]{{cite web|title=Jonathan Brewster Bingham|url=http://politicalgraveyard.com/bio/bingham.html|publisher=The Political Graveyard|accessdate=31 August 2013}} (June 20, 1919 – August 21, 2007), an author' playwright,[https://www.nytimes.com/2007/08/29/nyregion/29birge.html?ex=1346040000&en=a59ff4c2f207a44b&ei=5088&pa... "June Bingham Birge, Who Wrote Books and Plays, Dies at 88"], ''[[The New York Times]]'', August 29, 2007. Accessed May 4, 2008. "June Bingham Birge, the author of books and plays, died August 21 at her home in the Riverdale section of the Bronx. She was 88." and member of the [[Lehman family]] (her great-grandfather was [[Mayer Lehman]], one of the founders of the [[Lehman Brothers]] firm).[http://www.lehman.edu/lehman/enews/2007_08_27/feat_birge.html Lehman College: "June Bingham Birge, 1919 - 2007"] August 27, 2007 They had four children: Sherrell Bingham Downes; Timothy Woodbridge Bingham; Claudia Bingham Meyers; and June Mitchell (Micki) Esselstyn (d. 1999).[http://www.esselstyn.com/mickinews/tosuntwo.html Gainesville Sun: "Local reverend dies of cancer" By GARY KIRKLAND] October 28, 1999 After Jonathan Bingham's death, Mrs. Bingham married Robert Birge and was then known as [[June Bingham Birge]].[https://www.nytimes.com/1987/03/29/style/june-bingham-marries-robert-b-birge.html New York Times: "June Bingham Marries Robert B. Birge"] March 29, 1987 ==Death== Bingham died from complications of pneumonia, aged 72, at the Presbyterian Hospital in Manhattan on July 3, 1986. He was interred in Woodbridge Cemetery, in Salem, New London, Connecticut.[https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/98824104 Find-A-Grave] ==References== ==External links== {{CongBio|B000472}} {{s-start}} {{s-par|us-hs}} {{USRepSuccessionBox | state=New York| district=23 | district_ord=23rd | before=[[Charles A. Buckley]] | after= [[Peter A. Peyser]] | years=1965–1973}} {{USRepSuccessionBox | state=New York| district=22 | district_ord=22nd | before=[[Herman Badillo]] | after= [[Benjamin A. Gilman]] | years=1973–1983}} {{s-end}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bingham, Jonathan Brewster}} [[Category:1914 births]] [[Category:1986 deaths]] [[Category:Deaths from pneumonia]] [[Category:Groton School alumni]] [[Category:Members of the United States House of Representatives from New York (state)]] [[Category:New York (state) Democrats]] [[Category:Yale Law School alumni]] [[Category:Politicians from New Haven, Connecticut]] [[Category:Politicians from New York City]] [[Category:Democratic Party members of the United States House of Representatives]] [[Category:Lehman family]] [[Category:20th-century American politicians]] [[Category:Lawyers from New Haven, Connecticut]]

{{more citations needed|date=September 2013}} [[File:Sousedík.jpg|thumbnail|right|Josef Sousedík]] '''Josef Sousedík''' (18 December 1894 – 15 December 1944) was [[Czech people|Czech]] inventor, industrialist and resistance fighter.<ref name="vsetin">{{cite web |url=http://www.mestovsetin.cz/EN/vismo/dokumenty2.asp?id_org=100315&id=1002&p1=1001&vol_stavzobrazeni=2 |title=Important personalities in Vsetín history |publisher=Vsetín official city website |author= |date=January 8, 2007 |accessdate=September 22, 2013}}</ref>
==Life==
Josef Sousedík grew up in a poor family in [[Vsetín]] in [[Czechoslovakia]]. After finishing elementary school he trained as an electrician. He fought in the [[Austria-Hungary]] army during [[World War I]] and participated in the [[Battle of Slovakia]] in 1918. He opened his own workshop in 1919,<ref name="vsetin"/> using his patents and inventions. The workshop expanded into a factory employing over 200 people by 1934.<ref name="vsetin"/> The factory went bankrupt in 1934 during the [[Great Depression]] and was bought by [[Tatra (company)|Ringhoffer-Tatra]], which employed Sousedík as a CEO.
He was twice elected mayor of [[Vsetín]] from 1927–1938.<ref name="vsetin"/>
Sousedík was an anti-Nazi resistance leader during [[World War II]], collaborating with the [[Clay Eva]] group and the [[1st Czechoslovak Partisan Brigade of Jan Žižka]]. He was arrested in 1944 and shot dead after a fight during an interrogation.<ref name="vsetin"/> Sousedík was decorated with the [[Czechoslovak War Cross 1939–1945|Czechoslovak War Cross]] ({{lang-cs|Válečný kříž}}) in memoriam by Czechoslovak president [[Edvard Beneš]].
The [[History of Czechoslovakia (1948–89)|Communist dictatorship]] suppressed recognition of Sousedík's acts due to his collaboration with Western states and factory ownership.<ref name="vsetin"/>
==Inventions and products==
Sousedík owned over 50 patents, mostly in the electrical field, such as an electrical rudder. His factory produced electrical parts for the [[ČSD Class M 290.0]] and for the [[Tatra T86]].

The following provides a full list of cameras and notable accessories manufactured under the [[Red Digital Cinema|Red Digital Cinema Company]] brand. ==Cameras== ===RED ONE=== [[File:Redonecamera.JPG|thumb|The RED ONE in a simple setup]] The RED ONE was RED Digital Cinema’s first production camera.{{cite web|url=http://www.digital-intermediate.co.uk/examples/redcamera/redcamera.htm|title=The RED Digital Camera Company|work=digital-intermediate.co.uk}} Using an S35mm image plane, the RED ONE displays a natural depth of field from 2K to over 4K resolutions.{{cite web|url=http://www.red.com/products/red-one|title=RED ONE|work=red.com}} The first RED ONEs were outfitted with the 12 megapixel MYSTERIUM sensor, capable of capturing up to 120 frames per second at 2K resolution and 30 frames per second at 4K resolution.{{cite web|url=http://www.simdigital.com/rental_product.aspx?pid=333|title=RENTALS|work=simdigital.com}} The only possible acquisition format is REDCODE RAW. The cameras were initially sold with a CF card slot that later could be replaced with a REDMAG module. The second generation, RED ONE MYSTERIUM-X has a 14 megapixel MYSTERIUM-X sensor. It captures up to 120 frames per second at 2K resolution and up to 30 frames per second at 4K resolution. With the upgraded sensor, the RED ONE MYSTERIUM-X offers more dynamic range, higher sensitivity and enhanced color management tools than the RED ONE MYSTERIUM.{{cite web|url=http://www.red.com/products/red-one#features|title=RED ONE|work=red.com}} {| class="wikitable" ! This allows reduced file sizes while still keeping all advantages of a non-destructive RAW workflow. In the beginning REDCODE was a JPEG2000 12bit linear file stream with PCM sound without encryption. Several third party applications were able to read and convert to other file format such as Cineform RAW. Redcode started as having two different options, named Redcode 28 and Redcode 36, later a 42 option was added. With the introduction of the DSMC line compression ratios were introduced, making Formlerly in 28Mbs now x:x ffMpegasset.{{Citation needed|reason=Your explanation here|date=October 2016}} ===HDRx=== With the DSMC line HDRx was introduced as extension to Frame Summing asset; allowing the shooter to get up to 6 extra stops of dynamic range on a shot.{{Citation needed|reason=Your explanation here|date=October 2016}} ==Media== ===RED CF=== Proprietary CF cards ===REDMAG 1.8" SSD=== Proprietary SSD ===RED MINI-MAGs=== Proprietary SSD in sizes of 120GB, 240GB, 480GB and 960GB. ===Network=== Capture over LAN ==RCP Development Kit== Announced at NAB 2013 and launched in 2014, The RCP Development Kit is a SDK (software development kit) that allows programmers to create custom applications to control their camera via mobile device, computer, or micro-controller. The kit included the RCP Bridge, a wireless module that allows apps to communicate with the camera. The bridge supports a wireless communication range of approximately 50 feet.{{cite web|url=https://www.engadget.com/2014/04/07/red-wireless-control/|title=Red adds wireless camera control module, software development kit|author=Zach Honig|publisher=AOL|work=Engadget}} ==Workflow== === REDCINE-X PRO === REDCINE-X PRO is a free-of-charge post-processing software collection developed by RED, built specifically for RED camera systems. It includes a coloring toolset, integrated timeline, and post effects software collection for both stills and motion. The post-production software allows for non-destructive manipulation of raw .R3D files.{{cite web|url=http://www.red.com/products/redcine-x|title=REDCINE-X PRO|work=red.com}}REDCINE-X was the first workflow software developed solely by Red. Like REDCINE, RED offered it as an end-to-end workflow solution for Red customers. It preceded the current REDCINE-X PRO. With REDCINE-X PRO, users can mark frames while shooting and access those specific frames within their timeline. Additionally, there are features like A.D.D. (Advanced DRAGON [[Bayer_filter|Debayer]]), a new algorithm for Dragon that analyzes every pixel, plus grading and RAW adjustment options.{{cite web|url=http://nofilmschool.com/2014/02/red-epic-dragon-camera-a-d-d-advanced-debayer-upgrade-few-months/|title=RED DRAGON Camera is Getting A.D.D. & General Upgrades May Start in the Next Few Months|work=No Film School}} ====Previous Workflow Software==== "RED Alert!" was the first form of workflow made available to RED owners/operators, though it was more of a diagnostic tool. It allowed RED ONE users to tweak [[Bayer_filter|debayer]] settings and render out to dpx/tiff/mov.http://digitalfilms.wordpress.com/2009/03/28/red-post-–-the-easy-way/ REDCINE was the first end-to-end workflow for RED users. A third-party company developed the software, and RED provided the [[Software Development Kit|SDK]]. ===Hardware accelerators=== ====RED ROCKET==== Red Rocket is an internal PCI Express card that is capable of 4K, 2K, or 1080p real-time [[debayering]] and video playback of R3D files coming from Mysterium and Mysterium-X sensors. It can be used to accelerate video editing in compatible Non-linear editing systems, outputting the image via HD-SDI to a user-supplied monitor. A component of the Red Rocket allows users to convert the HD-SDI signal to four HDMI outputs.{{cite web|url=http://www.red.com/products/red-rocket|title=RED ROCKET®|work=red.com}} ====RED ROCKET-X==== RED ROCKET-X is an internal PCI Express card optimized for the 6K RED DRAGON sensor and is designed to accelerate the processing of R3D workflow, regardless of resolution. Compared to RED ROCKET, RED ROCKET-X processes and transcodes files up to five times faster. Debayering subpar asset.{{Citation needed|reason=Your explanation here|date=October 2016}} ===Third party workflow systems=== RED offers the RED Apple Workflow Installer, which allows R3D RAW settings within Final Cut Pro X. Other applications include support for QuickTime to use .R3D files, and plugins for Adobe Photoshop,https://www.red.com/downloads/508ebcee17ef022b21000558 Adobe Premiere Pro, Avid Media Composer, Final Cut Pro X, and Sony Vegas Pro. ==Notable accessories== ===3-Axis lens control system=== The RED 3-Axis lens control system is a turn-key wireless lens control kit for driving focus, iris and zoom. Included is the T.H.C. (Tactical Hand Controller), a wireless remote that allows the operator to adjust lens settings from a distance.{{cite web|url=http://www.red.com/learn/product-demos/red-3-axis-lens-control-system|title=RED 3-AXIS LENS CONTROL SYSTEM|work=red.com}} ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Corporation-related lists|Red digital cinema]] [[Category:Cameras by brand|Red Digital Cinema]]

[[File:MANUEL AYAU CORDON.JPG|thumb|right|Manuel Ayau]] '''Manuel Francisco Ayau Cordón''' (December 27, 1925 – August 4, 2010) was the Founder of the [[Universidad Francisco Marroquín]] in Guatemala, a [http://www.newmedia.ufm.edu/gsm/index.php?title=Interview_with_Rose_and_Milton_Friedman leading] private University in Latin America. He was born in [[Guatemala City]], on December 27, 1925. After diverse studies, he obtained a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering from [[Louisiana State University]] in 1950, an L.H.D. from [[Hillsdale College]] in 1973, and an honorary degree in law ([[Legum Doctor]]) from [[Northwood University]] in 1994.
==Scholarly and Laboral Contributions== His many entrepreneurial activities include that of CEO of "Samboro, S.A.", a company dedicated to the production of ceramic tiles; and of directing a group of [[Guatemala]]n industrialists for over forty years in the production of industrial gases and hydro-electric energy. Dr. Ayau has also served on the board of directors of several different companies, including [[IBM]] in Latin America and the Guatemalan local stock and debt exchange, of which he was founding President.
In 1959 he also founded the [http://www.cees.org.gt Center for Economic and Social Studies] (CEES) in Guatemala, to analyze the fundaments and philosophy of free society. In 1972 he was instrumental in founding the [[Universidad Francisco Marroquín|Francisco Marroquín University]], of which he was the first President until 1988.
A member of the [[Mont Pelerin Society]] since 1964, he was its President from 1978 to 1980. He was on the board of directors of the [[Liberty Fund]] in [[Indianapolis]]<ref>http://www.libertyfund.org</ref> and he was also a trustee of the [[Foundation for Economic Education]] in New York. He was also a member of the [[Philadelphia Society]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://phillysoc.org/DistinguishedMembers.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-05-05 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120118151439/http://phillysoc.org/DistinguishedMembers.pdf |archivedate=2012-01-18 |df= }}</ref>
In Guatemala, Dr. Ayau entered politics as a member of congress from 1970 to 1974, and as presidential candidate in the 1990 elections.
Twice he has formed part of the Central Bank council and has been president of two different commercial banks, Vice-President of the National Electrification Institute (INDE), trustee of the Philadelphia Society, and Honorary Member of the engineering society "[[Tau Beta Pi]]".
His last contribution to Guatemala was as President of Asociacion Civil proReforma <ref>"[http://www.newmedia.ufm.edu/presentacionproreforma Conference by Manuel F. Ayau]" at Francisco Marroquin University. Guatemala, January 2008</ref> del Estado de Guatemala.
In 2004 he was [http://noticias.ufm.edu/index.php/Homenaje_a_Manuel_F._Ayau_en_la_Mont_Pelerin_Society awarded] by the Mont Pelerin Society for his contributions to freedom. Manuel Ayau obtained the [http://www.apee.org/award-adam-smith.html Adam Smith Award], from the [[Association of Private Enterprise Education]] in 2005. He obtained the [https://web.archive.org/web/20090221072420/http://juandemariana.org/video/2256/discurso/agradecimiento/manuel/ayau/ Juan de Mariana Award], from the Instituto Juan de Mariana, in Spain, in 2008. That year, at the Universidad Peruana de Ciencias Applicadas, he was appointed Honorary Professor.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.upc.edu.pe/0/modulos/NOT/NOT_DetallarNoticia.aspx?PFL=0&NOT=509 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2009-03-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110526201109/http://www.upc.edu.pe/0/modulos/NOT/NOT_DetallarNoticia.aspx?PFL=0&NOT=509 |archivedate=2011-05-26 |df= }}</ref>
==Works== Among his most important works are "Como Mejorar el Nivel de Vida", "De Robinson a Viernes", "El Comercio", "La Década Perdida", "El Proceso Económico",<ref>"[http://www.newmedia.ufm.edu/presentacionlibro Conference by Manuel F. Ayau]" at Francisco Marroquin University. Guatemala, October 1994</ref> "No Tenemos que Seguir Siendo Pobres para Siempre" and "Un Juego que no suma cero". He has been published widely in Guatemala and Latin America, as well as in the US, including in "Vision", "The Wall Street Journal", and "The Freeman".
Liberty Fund podcast from 2001, [A Conversation with Manuel Ayau] https://web.archive.org/web/20090404041107/http://65.203.85.21/Home3/Audio.php?recordID=0517.06

"the wealthiest Hungarian" | boards = [[OTP Bank]] | networth = $ 1.96 billion | father = | mother = | spouse = | children = Timur
Ruslan
and one other son | relatives = | religion = }} '''Mihail Rahimkulov''' ({{lang-ru|Михаил Николаевич Рахимкулов}}, also known as '''Megdet Rahimkulov''', 16 October 1945, [[Moscow]]) is a [[Russia]]n-born [[Hungary|Hungarian]] businessman of [[Tatar]] origin. He was a [[Gazprom]] executive[http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qa3724/is_20071103/ai_n21086344/ Putin's game in European energy: divide and conquer] Spectator, The, Nov 3, 2007 by Barnett, Neil and also the former head of [[Panrusgaz]] and Általános Értékforgalmi Bank. He is the 1,468th on the [[Forbes]] world's billionaires list.{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/megdet-rahimkulov/|title=Forbes Profile|author=|date=|website=Forbes|accessdate=8 March 2018}} He is the wealthiest person in Hungary and a leading owner of [[OTP Bank]].[http://444.hu/2013/07/19/csanyi-elmenekult-az-otp-bol/ Csányi elmenekült az OTP-ből, 444.hu (Hungarian)] His assets are now managed by a holding company in Cyprus. ==Early life== Rahimkulov received his first higher education at the All-Union Correspondence Financial and Economic Institute. He graduated in 1973. In 1978, Rahimkulov earned a second diploma from the State University of Management in Moscow. In 1971, Rahimkulov, still a student, took a job at the USSR Ministry of the Gas Industry.{{cite web|url=http://finparty.ru/personal/megdet-rakhimkulov/|title=БИОГРАФИЯ — МЕГДЕТ РАХИМКУЛОВ|author=|date=|website=FinParty|accessdate=8 March 2018}} ==Career== After graduating from State University of Management, Rahimkulov became deputy head of Soyuzgazavtomatiki, a Mingazprom enterprise. From 1989 to 1992, he was the general director of Gazexport. In 1992, Rahimkulov was appointed General Director of OOO Interpromkom (InterProm), a company that supplied IT equipment to Gazprom. Rahimkulov became a Chief Executive and 10% owner of a Gazprom and MOL joint venture in the mid 1990s. MOL is a Hungarian multinational oil and gas company. When Gazprom acquired AEB, a Hungarian bank, Rahimkulov maintained a 6% direct holding in the bank until 2011. Rahimkulov and his sons, Ruslan and Timur, sold their entire share of MOL to VCP Capital Partners Unternehmensberatung AG in September of 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.portfolio.hu/en/tool/print/1/12210|title=Rahimkulov family parts with entire holding in Hungarian MOL|author=|date=|website=Portfolio.hu|accessdate=8 March 2018}} Rahimkulov bought shares in OTP, a leading Hungarian bank, with the proceeds from the MOL sale. As of September 2017, he and his sons own 24,186,511 shares in OTP, giving them 8.64% ownership of the company.{{cite web|url=https://www.otpbank.hu/portal/en/IR/Shares/OwnershipStructure|title=Ownership structure|author=|date=|website=OTP Bank|accessdate=8 March 2018}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/d8ec7144-44e5-11db-b804-0000779e2340.html?nclick_check=1 Financial Times profile] {{DEFAULTSORT:Rahimkulov, Megdet}} [[Category:1945 births]] [[Category:Russian businesspeople]] [[Category:Russian billionaires]] [[Category:Hungarian businesspeople]] [[Category:Hungarian billionaires]] [[Category:Gazprom people]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Moscow]] {{Hungary-bio-stub}} {{Russia-bio-stub}}

New Zealand Entrepreneur of the Year (2008)
[[New Zealand Order of Merit|KNZM]] (2011) | signature = | website = | footnotes = | misc = }} '''Sir Richard Michael Hill''' {{post-nominals|country=NZL|KNZM}} (born 23 December 1938) is a New Zealand [[Jewellery|jeweller]], entrepreneur and philanthropist who founded global jewellery retailer [[Michael Hill Jeweller]] in 1979. He retired as the company's chairman in November 2015. He currently resides in [[Arrowtown]] and was [[Ernst & Young]]'s 2008 Entrepreneur of the Year in New Zealand. == Early life and career == Born in [[Whangarei]] on 23 December 1938, Hill was educated at [[Whangarei Boys' High School]] from 1949 to 1954.{{cite book |editor-last=Taylor |editor-first=Alister |title=New Zealand Who's Who Aotearoa 2001 |year=2001 |publisher=Alister Taylor Publishers |location=Auckland |issn=1172-9813}} Hill recalls being bullied, stating that he "hated” his time at school.{{Cite web|url=https://www.stuff.co.nz/waikato-times/news/4658119/Daisies-from-Michael-Hill-romantic|title=Daisies from Michael Hill - romantic|website=Stuff|language=en|access-date=2018-11-08}} He left school at 16 to pursue a career as a concert violinist but a year later was told he would have had to start much younger in life to be a noteworthy musician.{{Cite book | last = Hill | first = Michael | authorlink = Michael Hill (entrepreneur) |author2=Bryan Staff | title = HELLO – Michael Hill Jeweller | publisher = Penguin Books (NZ) Ltd | year = 1994 | location = New Zealand | isbn = 0-670-86033-6}} Hill abandoned his hopes of a career in music and started working for his uncle, Arthur Fisher, at the family jewellery store. He performed well as a salesman and window dresser, winning international awards for his efforts in the latter.{{Cite book | last = Hill | first = Michael | authorlink = Michael Hill (entrepreneur) |author2=Claire Harvey | title = Toughen Up: What I've learned about surviving tough times | publisher = Random House New Zealand | year = 2009 | location = New Zealand | isbn = 978-1-86979-046-2}} He later took over the store's newspaper and radio advertising, drawing attention to the business with bizarre themes for the advertisements, and was later promoted to manager. In the spring of 1964, while working in the store, Hill met Christine Roe, an Englishwoman who taught art at a local high school. They married in March 1965 and had two children, Mark (born 1969) and Emma (born 1971). On 1 October 1977, the house that had taken them four years to build was destroyed in a fire.{{citation needed|date=October 2013}} == Michael Hill Jeweller == {{see also|Michael Hill Jeweller}} Following this setback, Hill re-assessed his life. With the help of a friend, he tried to buy his uncle's business, but the uncle refused to sell. On 13 May 1979, Hill opened his own jewellery store nearby, calling it [[Michael Hill Jeweller]]. One of his main points of difference was to limit his store's product range to jewellery items, dispensing with silverware, clocks, porcelain and glassware commonly found in other jewellery stores at the time. Hill had set himself a goal of "seven stores in seven years", and in 1986 he exceeded that, opening his eighth store in [[Newmarket, New Zealand|Newmarket]]. On 9 June 1987, Hill floated Michael Hill Jeweller on the [[New Zealand Exchange|New Zealand Stock Exchange]], raising enough capital to expand the business locally and into the Australian market, where the company opened four stores in [[Brisbane]] later that year. In 1988, Hill set himself and his company another goal: "70 shops in seven years". This goal was also achieved. In 2002, the goal of opening 1000 stores by 2022 was established by Hill, with the further aim of taking the brand global. During that same year, the company opened its first three stores in Canada, and by the end of 2009 the company had 242 stores in Australia, Canada, New Zealand and the United States.{{Citation needed|date=May 2010}} Hill's daughter, Emma Hill, succeeded him as chairman after the November 2015 [[annual general meeting]].{{cite news |last1=Harris |first1=Catherine |title=Following in dad's footsteps |work=[[The Press]] |date=15 August 2015 |page=C15}} === Philanthropy === Although he didn't become a concert violinist, Hill has maintained a strong love for the violin his entire life and continues to play. In 2001 he founded the biennial Michael Hill International Violin Competition "for emerging young violinists".{{Cite web | title = Michael Hill International Violin Competition – The Michael Hill Story | url=http://www.michaelhillinternationalviolincompetition.com/index.php/pi_pageid/106 | accessdate = 24 May 2010 }} The winner of the competition receives a substantial cash prize, a recording deal for international distribution and a "Winner's Tour" in which the competition winner performs in concert halls around New Zealand and Australia in the calendar year following the competition.{{Cite web | title = Michael Hill International Violin Competition – 2011 Competition Prizes | url=http://www.michaelhillinternationalviolincompetition.com/index.php/pi_pageid/146 | accessdate = 24 May 2010 }} === The Hills golf course === [[File:Wolves are coming4.JPG|thumb|''The Wolves are Coming''—when installed at [[798 Art Zone]]]] After buying a run-down farm in Arrowtown, Hill's interest in golf grew to the point where he built his own 18-hole golf course called The Hills on the property.{{cite web |url=http://www.remarkablegolftours.co.nz/the-hills-golf.php |title=The Hills Golf Course |date= |website= |publisher=Remarkable Golf Tours |accessdate=29 October 2016}} Built into the course is a unique two-thirds underground clubhouse designed by [[Auckland]] architect [[Andrew Patterson (architect)|Andrew Patterson]] and his company, Patterson Associates. The clubhouse won the [[New Zealand Institute of Architects]] Supreme Architectural Award in 2008 and was a finalist in the [[World Architecture Festival]] in 2008 in [[Barcelona]].{{Citation | last = Turner | first = Greg | title = A world class golfing experience | pages = 24–26 | magazine = The Cut | location = New Zealand | date = November 2007 | url =http://www.thehills.co.nz/media/thecut-nov7.pdf | accessdate = 10 May 2010}}{{Cite web | title = A double honour for New Zealand architect | url=http://mch.govt.nz/blog/2008/07/30/a-double-honour-for-new-zealand-architect/ | accessdate = 6 May 2010 }} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} The course is notable for the sculpture which makes much of the course into an open-air gallery. Giant sculptures dot the course, many of them the work of Hill's son, sculptor Mark Hill."[http://www.odt.co.nz/sport/golf/203105/pga-provides-chance-view-sculpture-private-course PGA provides chance to view sculpture on private course]," J. Beech, ''Otago Daily Times, 28 March 2012. These works complement Michael Hill's own impressive collection of art. Hill had ''The Wolves are Coming'' by Chinese sculptor Liu Ruo Wang installed. Originally on display at [[798 Art Zone]] in Beijing, the 110 larger-than-life wolf figurines were placed at the golf course in October 2012 on a site chosen by the artist, and not at the site prepared by Hill's staff. At the centre of the installation is a sword-wielding warrior; this piece alone weighs {{convert|3|tonne}}.{{cite news|last=Chandler |first=Philip |title=Sir Michael's stunning new sculptures |url=http://www.scene.co.nz/sir-michaels-stunning-new-sculptures/304094a1.page |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121220000442/http://www.scene.co.nz/sir-michaels-stunning-new-sculptures/304094a1.page |dead-url=yes |archive-date=20 December 2012 |accessdate=28 October 2012 |newspaper=Mountain Scene |date=18 October 2012 }}{{cite news|last=Edens|first=John|title=These wolves are teed off |url= http://www.stuff.co.nz/southland-times/news/7834034/These-wolves-are-teed-off |accessdate=28 October 2012|newspaper=The Southland Times|date=18 October 2012}} ==== New Zealand Open ==== The 2007, 2009 and 2010 [[New Zealand Open]] golf tournaments were held at The Hills.{{cite news|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/southland-times/sport/3280040/Hills-aims-for-a-par-2011|title=Hills aims for a par 2011 |last=COWLISHAW |first=SHANE |date=1 February 2010|publisher=The Southland Times |accessdate=10 May 2010}} === VvS1 yacht === {{see also|VvS1 (yacht)}} In April 2007, Hill launched the VvS1, a 112-foot [[Luxury yacht|super yacht]] built for luxury charters in the South Pacific. Designed by Hill and his wife, Christine, the vessel won three awards in the 2008 World Yacht Awards in Cannes: Best Motor Yacht, Best Interior and Best Functionality.{{Citation |title = diamond |magazine = M2 Magazine |location = New Zealand |date = 29 September 2008 |url = http://www.yachtvvs1.com/media/M2_Luxury_Yacht.pdf |accessdate = |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20110718133314/http://www.yachtvvs1.com/media/M2_Luxury_Yacht.pdf# |archive-date = 18 July 2011 |dead-url = yes |df = dmy-all }} == Books == Hill has had three books published about succeeding in business. The books use stories from his own life to illustrate his points about achieving success. * ''HELLO – Michael Hill Jeweller'' was published by [[Penguin Books]] in 1994. * ''Toughen Up: What I've learned about surviving tough times'' was published by [[Random House]] in 2009. * ''think BIGGER: How To Raise Your Expectations And Achieve Everything'' was published by [[Random House]] in 2010.Hill, Michael. ''[https://books.google.com/books/about/Think_Bigger.html?id=VFU1bwAACAAJ&redir_esc=y Think Bigger: How to Raise Your Expectations & Achieve Everything]''. Random House, 2010. == Recognition == Hill was awarded the [[New Zealand 1990 Commemoration Medal]]. In the [[2002 New Year Honours]] Hill was appointed a [[New Zealand Order of Merit|Companion of the New Zealand Order of Merit]] for services to business and the arts.{{cite web |url=http://www.dpmc.govt.nz/node/385 |title=New Year honours list 2002 |date=31 December 2001 |publisher=Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet |accessdate=8 April 2016}} He was promoted to Knight Companion of the same order in the [[2011 New Year Honours (New Zealand)|2011 New Year Honours]], also for services to business and the arts.{{cite web | url=https://www.dpmc.govt.nz/publications/new-year-honours-list-2011 | title=New Year honours list 2011 |date=31 December 2010| publisher=Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet | accessdate=5 January 2018}} Hill received Ernst & Young New Zealand's Entrepreneur of the Year award in 2008. The awards "acknowledge the accomplishments of entrepreneurs and celebrate the contribution they are making to New Zealand's economy and society".{{Cite web |title=Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year 2008 Category Winners |url=http://www.ey.com/NZ/en/Newsroom/News-releases/Press-Release---Ernst---Young-Entrepreneur-Of-The-Year-2008-Category-Winners |accessdate=30 April 2006 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100426011333/http://www.ey.com/NZ/en/Newsroom/News-releases/Press-Release---Ernst---Young-Entrepreneur-Of-The-Year-2008-Category-Winners |archivedate=26 April 2010 |df= }} == References == {{Reflist|30em}} == External links == * [http://www.michaelhill.com Michael Hill Jeweller] * [http://www.thehills.co.nz The Hills Golf Club] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20100330072849/http://www.yachtvvs1.com/ VvS1 yacht] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20160324091301/http://www.michaelhillinternationalviolincompetition.com/ Michael Hill International Violin Competition] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hill, Michael}} [[Category:1938 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:New Zealand merchants]] [[Category:New Zealand businesspeople]] [[Category:People from Whangarei]] [[Category:New Zealand art collectors]] [[Category:Knights Companion of the New Zealand Order of Merit]] [[Category:New Zealand jewellers]] [[Category:People educated at Whangarei Boys' High School]] [[Category:Businesspeople awarded knighthoods]]

Hilton]] (paternal uncle) * [[Kim Richards]] (maternal aunt) * [[Kyle Richards]] (maternal aunt) }} | website = {{URL|http://www.nickyhilton.com}} | imagesize = | othername = | spouse = {{marriage|Todd Meister
|2004|2004|reason=ann.}}
{{marriage|James Rothschild
|2015}} | children = 2 }} '''Nicholai Olivia Rothschild''' (née '''Hilton'''; born October 5, 1983){{cite web| url = http://nickyhilton.com/meet-nicky/ | title= Meet Nicky | publisher=Nicky Hilton official site|accessdate= January 13, 2016|archivedate= December 5, 2015 | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151205124930/http://nickyhilton.com/meet-nicky/ | deadurl=no}}{{cite web| url=http://www.glamourmagazine.co.uk/nicky-hilton | title= Nicky Hilton | publisher= [[Glamour (magazine)|Glamourmagazine.co.uk]]| location = UK| accessdate= January 13, 2016}} is an American businesswoman, socialite, model and fashion designer. She is a member of the [[Hilton family]] by birth, and a member of the [[Rothschild family]] through her marriage to James Rothschild, a grandson of [[Victor Rothschild, 3rd Baron Rothschild]], in 2015.{{Cite web|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/nicky-hilton-changes-name-instagram-meets-monkey-honeymoon-2015167|title=Nicky Hilton Changes Her Name on Instagram, Meets Monkey on Honeymoon!|website=Us Weekly|access-date=2016-04-22}} ==Early life== Hilton was born in [[New York City]] and raised in [[Los Angeles]]. She is the daughter of [[Richard Hilton]], a hotel heir of the [[Hilton family]] who works as a businessman in real estate and [[Kathy Hilton]] (née Avanzino), a former actress and half sister of [[Kim Richards|Kim]] and [[Kyle Richards]]. Hilton was named for her great-uncle, [[Conrad Hilton, Jr.|Conrad Nicholson Hilton, Jr.]]''Elizabeth'', J. Randy Taraborrelli. Page 94. August 2006. She is the second of four children: she has an older sister, [[Paris Hilton|Paris Whitney Hilton]] (born 1981), and two younger brothers, Barron Nicholas Hilton II (born 1989) and Conrad Hughes Hilton III (born 1994). Hilton was raised [[Catholic Church|Roman Catholic]].[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L_ZTfPgIBp0 Paris & Nicky Hilton – [Jan-2003] – interview]. YouTube. Retrieved on 2010-12-29. She has Norwegian, German, Italian, English, Irish, and Scottish ancestry. Hilton graduated from [[Convent of the Sacred Heart (New York)|Convent of the Sacred Heart]], an all-girls Catholic school on the [[Upper East Side]], in 2001. She took courses at [[Fashion Institute of Technology]] and [[Parsons The New School for Design]] but does not have a degree.[http://www.accessoriesmagazine.com/3591/nicky-hilton-plans-fashion-jewelry-line "Nicky Hilton Plans Fashion Jewelry Line"]. ''Accessories Magazine''. July 20, 2010.[http://www.elle.com/news/fashion-style/parsons-gala-full-of-promise-41763 "PARSONS GALA FULL OF PROMISE"]. ''Elle''. May 2012. ==Career== ===Fashion designer=== In 2004, Hilton launched her own clothing line.{{cite web|url=http://www.kidzworld.com/article/6178-celebrity-fashion-lines-nicky-hilton |title=Celebrity Fashion Lines - Nicky Hilton|publisher=Kidzworld.com |date= |accessdate=2014-05-19}} She also designed a line of handbags for Japanese company Samantha Thavasa. In 2007, she started her second line, Nicholai, at a higher price point.[http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-207_162-3929213.html "Paris Hilton's Sis Shows Her Sexy Side"]. CBS. February 11, 2009 Nicholai held its fashion show for the spring/summer 2008 season on September 9, 2007, in New York City during Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week. In 2014, Hilton launched a 10-piece collection with eLuxe. She designed each piece as a reflection of her personal style and named all products for the women in her family, who embody the style of each piece.{{cite news |url=http://www.wwd.com/markets-news/ready-to-wear-sportswear/hilton-to-roll-out-eluxe-line-7934160 |title=Nicky Hilton to Roll Out eLuxe Line |work=Women's Wear Daily |date=2014-09-22 |accessdate=2014-09-22 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140924140432/http://www.wwd.com/markets-news/ready-to-wear-sportswear/hilton-to-roll-out-eluxe-line-7934160 |archivedate=September 24, 2014 |df= }} In 2010, Hilton launched a line of jewelry. The pieces are fashion jewelry and in an Art Deco style, averaging around $200 per piece.{{Cite web|title = Accessories News: Nicky Hilton to Launch Jewelry Line|url = http://www.elle.com/fashion/accessories/news/a4560/accessories-news-nicky-hilton-to-launch-jewelry-line-192/|website = ELLE|date = 2010-08-16|accessdate = 2015-11-11}} In 2015, she launched a capsule collection of handbags as part of a collaboration with Linea Pelle. Hilton said she was approached by Linea Pelle "to make a capsule collection and I really wanted to have it be classic. As in I didn't want to make these super trendy bags that would be out of style next season."{{Cite web|title = Nicky Hilton Debuts Fall 2015 Capsule Collection with Linea Pelle: Designer Talks Handbags, Wedding Plans and More in EXCLUSIVE INTERVIEW|url = http://www.fashiontimes.com/articles/18900/20150226/nicky-hilton-fall-2015-collection-linea-pelle-handbags-wedding-exclusive-interview.htm|website = Fashion Times|date = 2015-02-26|accessdate = 2015-11-11}} In August 2017, Hilton announced her collaboration with Tolani for a Mommy and Me capsule collection. The collection launched in stores in spring 2018. {{Cite web|title = Pregnant Nicky Hilton Rothschild Announces New 'Mommy + Me' Clothing Line with Tolani|url = http://people.com/babies/nicky-hilton-rothschild-mommy-and-me-collection-tolani/|website = People|date = 2017-08-14|accessdate = 2017-08-23}} ===Model=== In 2005, Hilton was the face of Australian underwear line Antz Pantz alongside [[Kimberly Stewart]].{{cite web|url=http://www.antzpantz.com.au/Our-Products/Holeproof-Antz-Pantz.asp |title=Holeproof Antz Pantz|publisher=Antz Pantz |date=2005-11-27 |accessdate=2012-01-03 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20051127005657/http://www.antzpantz.com.au/Our-Products/Holeproof-Antz-Pantz.asp |archivedate=2005-11-27}}{{cite web|url=http://www.life.com/celebrity-pictures/55814692/antz-pantz-it-girl-search |title=Nicky Hilton, Kimberly Stewart, Nathan Sapsford - Antz Pantz IT Girl Search - Photo |website=Life |date=2005-09-28 |accessdate=2012-01-03}} Stewart remains contracted, but Hilton has been replaced by Australian model Megan Maitland.{{cite web|url=http://www.antzpantz.com.au/Our-Products/Holeproof-Antz-Pantz.asp |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060619071510/http://www.antzpantz.com.au/Our-Products/Holeproof-Antz-Pantz.asp|archivedate=2006-06-19 |title=Holeproof Antz Pantz|publisher=Antz Pantz|date=2006-06-19 |accessdate=2012-01-03}} Around this time, Hilton modeled for the cover of ''[[Lucire]]'' for its New Zealand and [[Romania]]n editions.{{cite web|author=Brad Batory |url=http://lucire.com/2005a/0906fe0.shtml |title=Lucire Fashion: Making of a heiress: Lucire's cover girl, Nicky Hilton, as produced by Brad Batory of Indashio - The global fashion magazine |publisher=Lucire.com |date= |accessdate=2012-01-03}} ===Other ventures=== [[File:Nicky Hilton Sepia.jpg|thumb|Hilton in September 2010]] In 2006, she entered a partnership to open two Nicky O Hotels, the first in [[Miami]] and the second in [[Chicago]]. That same year, Hilton sued her partner in Federal Court in Los Angeles for damages and to seek an injunction against his use of the name.{{Cite web|title = Nicky Hilton Sues Over Hotel|url = http://www.contactmusic.com/nicky-hilton/news/nicky-hilton-sues-over-hotel_1013752|website = Contactmusic.com|accessdate = 2015-11-11}} On February 12, 2007, Hilton was sued for breach of contract by her partners.{{cite web|url=http://www.hotel-online.com/News/PR2007_1st/Feb07_FalorNicky.html |title=Hotel Developer Robert Falor Suing Nicky Hilton; Alleges Breach of Contract and Deceptive Business Practices / February 2007 |publisher=Hotel-online.com |date=2007-02-13 |accessdate=2014-05-19}} In 2014, Hilton published her first book, ''365 Style.'' According to the author, the book "offers a simple method that helps girls identify the staple pieces that work best for their lifestyle, encourages them to stay true to their own tastes, and most importantly shows them how to have fun with fashion every day of the year."{{Cite web|title = An exclusive glimpse of Nicky Hilton's new 365 Style book cover|url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-2649683/NO-money-buy-style-An-exclusive-glimpse-Nicky-Hiltons-new-book-cover-shares-fail-proof-3-6-5-approach-dressing.html|website = Mail Online|accessdate = 2015-11-11}} ''365 Style'' was published by [[Harlequin Enterprises|Harlequin]], a subsidiary of [[HarperCollins]]. In 2015, Hilton collaborated with Smashbox, the cosmetic brand owned by [[Estée Lauder Companies]], to create a cosmetic line consisting of three limited-edition cat-inspired makeup kits (one for each of her favorite cities: New York City, Los Angeles and London).{{Cite web|title = Nicky Hilton Has a Seriously Cute New Project (Cat Lovers, Prepare to Freak!)|url = http://stylenews.peoplestylewatch.com/2015/06/05/nicky-hilton-smashbox-cosmetics-collaboraton-wedding-details/|website = PEOPLE.com|accessdate = 2015-11-11}} == Philanthropy == She has supported a range of charitable organizations, including [[Starlight Children's Foundation]], [[Make-A-Wish Foundation|Make-a-wish Foundation]], Race to Erase MS and [[Union Rescue Mission]].{{Cite web|title = Nicky Hilton: Charity Work & Causes|url = https://www.looktothestars.org/celebrity/nicky-hilton|website = Look to the Stars|accessdate = 2015-11-11}}{{Cite web|title = Day In The Life: Nicky Hilton|url = http://hauteliving.com/2015/11/day-in-the-life-nicky-hilton/592698/|website = Haute Living|accessdate = 2015-11-12}} ==Personal life== At 2:30 a.m. on August 15, 2004, Hilton married childhood friend and businessman Todd Meister at the Vegas Wedding Chapel in Las Vegas, Nevada.[http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,683766,00.html Nicky's Vegas Surprise], ''People'', August 19, 2004. Retrieved December 5, 2010. The marriage was annulled less than three months later, with Hilton and Meister explaining they traveled apart often and had married "on a whim".Lehner, Marla. [http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,780436,00.html Nicky Hilton Gets Marriage Annulled], ''People'', November 9, 2004. Retrieved December 5, 2010. In 2011, Hilton began dating financier James Rothschild (born 1985),[https://family.rothschildarchive.org/people/181-james-amschel-victor-rothschild-1985 "The Rothschild Archive: James Amschel Victor Rothschild (1985-)"]. ''The Rothschild Archive.'' a member of the [[Rothschild family]] and only son of [[Amschel Rothschild]], after being introduced at [[James Stunt]] and [[Petra Ecclestone]]'s wedding. On August 12, 2014, while on vacation at [[Lake Como]] in Italy, Hilton became engaged to Rothschild.[http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/nicky-hilton-engaged-to-james-rothschild-hotel-heiress-to-marry-heir-2014128 US Magazine: "Nicky Hilton Is Engaged to James Rothschild: Hotel Heiress to Marry Banking Heir" By Esther Lee and Brody Brown] August 12, 2014 On July 10, 2015, the couple married at The Orangery{{cite web|url=http://www.hrp.org.uk/KensingtonPalace/Foodanddrink/Orangery |title=Elegant Breakfasts, Lunches & Teas At Kensington Palace's Orangery |publisher=Hrp.org.uk |date= |accessdate=2015-09-29}}{{cite web|url=http://www.orangerykensingtonpalace.co.uk |title=Home - The OrangeryThe Orangery |publisher=Orangerykensingtonpalace.co.uk |date=2014-06-20 |accessdate=2015-09-29}} in [[Kensington Palace Gardens]]{{cite web|url=http://www.hellomagazine.com/brides/2015060325584/nicky-hilton-to-marry-kensington-palace/ |title=Nicky Hilton and James Rothschild to marry at Kensington Palace |publisher=hellomagazine.com |date= |accessdate=2015-09-29}} in [[London, England]].{{cite web|last=Pocklington |first=Rebecca |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/mr--mrs-first-pictures-6045133 |title=Mr & Mrs: First pictures of Nicky Hilton and James Rothschild on their wedding day as she flashes her garter - 3am & Mirror Online |publisher=Mirror.co.uk |date=2015-07-10 |accessdate=2015-09-29}}{{cite web|author=Susannah Butter and Phoebe Luckhurst |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/lifestyle/london-life/nicky-hilton-and-james-rothschilds-trillion-dollar-wedding-at-kensington-palace-the-guests-the-flowers-and-lionels-star-turn-10380233.html |title=Nicky Hilton and James Rothschild's trillion dollar wedding at Kensington Palace: the guests, the flowers and Lionel's star turn | London Life | Lifestyle | London Evening Standard |publisher=Standard.co.uk |date=2015-07-10 |accessdate=2015-09-29}} Hilton wore a $77,000 [[Valentino SpA|Valentino]] Haute Couture gown.{{cite web|last=McRady |first=Rachel |url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/nicky-hilton-changes-name-instagram-meets-monkey-honeymoon-2015167 |title=Nicky Hilton Changes Her Name on Instagram, Meets Monkey on Honeymoon! - Us Weekly |publisher=Usmagazine.com |date=2015-07-16 |accessdate=2015-09-29}} Her sister, Paris, served as maid of honor.{{cite web|last=Marquina |first=Sierra |url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-style/news/nicky-hilton-marries-james-rothschild-at-kensington-palace-2015107 |title=Nicky Hilton Marries: See Her Wedding Dress, Paris' Look, and More! - Us Weekly |publisher=Usmagazine.com |date=2015-07-10 |accessdate=2015-09-29}} The couple honeymooned in [[Botswana]].{{cite web|last=Coder |first=Maria |url=http://www.people.com/article/nicky-hilton-rothschild-honeymoon-pics-Instagram-surname-change |title=Nicky Hilton Rothschild Posts Honeymoon Pics on Instagram |publisher=People.com |date=2015-07-17 |accessdate=2015-09-29}} They have two daughters: Lily Grace Victoria (born July 2016)[http://celebritybabies.people.com/2016/07/08/nicky-hilton-rothschild-welcomes-daughter-lily-grace-victoria/ "Nicky Hilton Rothschild Welcomes Daughter Lily Grace Victoria"]. '''Owner earnings''' is a [[Valuation (finance)|valuation]] method detailed by [[Warren Buffett]] in 1986. He stated that the [[Enterprise value|value of a company]] is simply the total of the net [[cash flow]]s ('''owner earnings''') expected to occur over the life of the business, minus any reinvestment of earnings.<ref>{{cite book|last1=Hagstrom|first1=Robert|title=[[The Warren Buffett Way]]|publisher=Wiley|isbn=978-0-471-64811-6|page=113}}</ref>
Buffett defined owner earnings as follows:
:"These represent (a) reported [[earnings]] plus (b) [[depreciation]], [[Depletion (accounting)|depletion]], [[Amortization (business)|amortization]], and certain other non-cash charges...less (c) the average annual amount of [[Capital expenditure|capitalized expenditures]] for [[fixed asset|plant and equipment]], etc. that the business requires to fully maintain its long-term competitive position and its unit volume....Our owner-earnings equation does not yield the deceptively precise figures provided by [[Generally accepted accounting principles|GAAP]], since (c) must be a guess - and one sometimes very difficult to make. Despite this problem, we consider the owner earnings figure, not the GAAP figure, to be the relevant item for valuation purposes...All of this points up the absurdity of the '[[cash flow]]' numbers that are often set forth in [[Wall Street]] reports. These numbers routinely include (a) plus (b) - but do not subtract (c)."<ref>{{cite web | last = Buffett | first = Warren E. | title = 1986 Letter to Shareholders | publisher = Berkshire Hathaway, Inc | date = February 27, 1987 | url = http://www.berkshirehathaway.com/letters/1986.html | accessdate = 2007-05-22}}</ref>
==See also== * [[Berkshire Hathaway]]

'''Robert Louis (Bob) Flood''' (born 1955) is British organizational scientist, former Professor of [[Management Science]]s at the [[University of Hull]],<ref name= "RLF">Flood, Robert Louis. ''Rethinking the fifth discipline: Learning within the unknowable.'' Routledge, 2002. p. xiv.</ref> specialized in applied [[systemic thinking]], particularly in the areas of [[strategic management]], [[organizational behavior]] and organizational improvement.<ref>Rosenhead, Jonathan, and [[John Mingers]]. ''Rational analysis for a problematic world revisited.'' John Wiley and Sons, 2001.</ref><ref>Kemmis, Stephen, and Robin McTaggart. "Communicative action and the public sphere." Denzin, NK & Lincoln, YS (red.), ''The Sage handbook of qualitative research 3'' (2005): 559-603.</ref>
== Biography == Born in London in February 1955, Robert Flood received a first class B.A. in Systems and Management in 1983 at [[City University London|City University]] and his PhD in Philosophy in Systems Science at [[City University London|City University]] in 1985. In 1997 he was awarded a Doctor of Science from [[Hull University]] for his sustained and authoritative contribution to the field of systems science.<ref name= "RLF"/>
Prior to university Flood worked several years in the film business in the management of Paramount Pictures, in the health service for the Berkshire Area Health Authority, and at National Opinion Polls in London. In 1989 he was appointed Professor of [[Systems Science]] at the [[Hull University]], and currently is Professor of [[Action Research]] at the [[Norwegian University of Science and Technology]] in Trondheim.<ref name= "RLF"/> Flood has practiced as an independent action researcher since leaving [[Hull University]] in 1997.
Flood is founding and current editor of the international journal "Systemic Practice and Action Research" and is also associate editor of the "[[Systems Research and Behavioral Science]]" journal. He also has been a Fellow of the [[Institute of Measurement and Control]] and was a registered Chartered Engineer.<ref name= "RLF"/>
Flood was a nominee for the 'MCA (Management Consultants Association) 1993 Management Book of the Year Award' for Beyond TQM.
== Publications == Flood has authored and co-authored a dozen books and more than 100 articles. A selection: * Flood, Robert L., and [[Ewart Carson]]. ''Dealing with complexity: an introduction to the theory and application of systems science.'' Springer Science & Business Media, 1988, 1993. * Flood, Robert L., and [[Michael C. Jackson]]. ''Creative problem solving: Total systems intervention.'' Chichester: Wiley, 1991. * Flood, Robert L., and [[Michael C. Jackson]]. ''Critical systems thinking: Directed readings.'' Chichester: Wiley, 1991. * Flood, Robert L. ''Beyond TQM.'' Chichester: Wiley, 1993. * Flood, Robert L., and [[Norma RA Romm]]. ''Diversity management: Triple loop learning.'' Chichester: Wiley, 1996. * Flood, Robert L., and [[Norma RA Romm]]. ''Critical systems thinking: Current research and practice.'' Plenum: New York, 1996. * Flood, Robert L. ''Rethinking the fifth discipline: Learning within the unknowable.'' Routledge, 1999; 2002.
More recent well-cited articles include: * Flood, Robert L. 2010. The Relationship of systems thinking to action research. Systemic Practice and Action Research 23: 269-284. * Flood, Robert L., and [[Norma RA Romm]]. 2018. A systemic approach to processes of power in learning organisations. Part 1: Literature, theory, and methodology of triple loop learning. The Learning Organisation 25: 1-14.

revision.text:
'''Round-tripping''', also known as round-trip transactions or "Lazy Susans", is defined by ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'' as a form of [[barter]] that involves a company selling "an unused [[asset]] to another company, while at the same time agreeing to buy back the same or similar assets at about the same price." Swapping assets on a round-trip produces no net [[economic substance]], but may be fraudulently reported as a series of productive sales and beneficial purchases on the books of the companies involved, violating the [[substance over form]] accounting principle. The companies appear to be growing and very ''busy'', but the round-tripping ''business'' does not generate profits. Growth is an attractive factor to speculative investors, even if profits are lacking; such investment benefits companies and motivates them to undertake the illusory growth of round-tripping.
Round trips are characteristic of the [[New Economy]] companies. They played a crucial part in temporarily inflating the [[market capitalization]] of energy traders such as [[Enron]], [[CMS Energy]], [[Reliant Energy]], and [[Dynegy]].
In international scenarios, round tripping is used for tax evasion<ref>Michelle Hanlon, Edward L. Maydew, and Jacob R. Thornock: Taking the Long Way Home: Offshore Investments in U.S. Equity and Debt Markets and U.S. Tax Evasion; presented at 2010 National Tax Association meeting, EIASM 2011 Workshop on Current Research on Taxation at the University of Münster, 1 Sep.2011.</ref> and money laundering as well.<ref>Aswath Rau and Pallabi Ghosal: “Entering the Tiger’s Den: Foreign Investment in India through Mauritius or Singapore”; ''Singapore Law Gazette'', Feb.2012.</ref>
Other companies making unconventional round-tripping deals include [[AOL]] with [[Sun Microsystems]] and [[Global Crossing]] with [[Qwest Communications]]. It is alleged that when some telecommunications companies swapped capacity, they booked the value of the incoming capacity as revenue and the value of the outgoing capacity as an [[investment]]. These transactions had the effect of inflating profits. The [[United States Securities and Exchange Commission|SEC]] ruled that booking revenues from swaps in telecommunications capacity was improper.
Many such companies have used round-tripping to distort the market by establishing false [[revenue recognition|revenue benchmarks]], aiming to meet or beat the numbers put out by [[Wall Street]] stock analysts. As a result of abusive round trips, barter between publicly held companies has become discredited among professional investors.
==See also== * [[Accounting scandals]] * [[Forensic accounting]] * [[List of corporate collapses and scandals]]
